doc:
James Bell (actor) https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Bell_(actor) 0 James Harlee Bell (December 1, 1891 – October 26, 1973) was an American film and stage actor who appeared in about 150 films and television shows through 1964. Bell was born in Suffolk, Virginia, and attended Virginia Polytechnic Institute. In 1920, he made his theatrical debut as Venustiano in The Bad Man. He worked steadily on Broadway through 1941. His first film role was in I Am a Fugitive from a Chain Gang in 1932. Among his television appearances were four guest roles on Perry Mason. In 1958 he played murder victim J.J. Stanley in "The Case of the Green-Eyed Sister," and murderer P.E. Overbrook in "The Case of the Lazy Lover." In 1960 he played murderer Zack Davis in "The Case of the Frantic Flyer," and murder victim Silas Vance in "The Case of the Lavender Lipstick." Bell was married to Joyce Arling. James_Harlee_Bell ( December_1_,_1891 – October_26_,_1973 ) was an_American_film_and_stage_actor who appeared in about_150_films_and_television_shows through 1964 . Bell was_born in Suffolk , Virginia , and attended Virginia_Polytechnic_Institute . In 1920 , he made his_theatrical_debut as Venustiano in The_Bad_Man . He worked steadily on Broadway through 1941 . His_first_film_role was in I Am a_Fugitive from a_Chain_Gang in 1932 . Among his_television_appearances were four_guest_roles on Perry_Mason . In 1958 he played murder_victim_J.J._Stanley in " The_Case of the_Green-Eyed_Sister , " and murderer_P.E._Overbrook in " The_Case of the_Lazy_Lover . " In 1960 he played murderer_Zack_Davis in " The_Case of the_Frantic_Flyer , " and murder_victim_Silas_Vance in " The_Case of the_Lavender_Lipstick . " Bell was_married to Joyce_Arling .
